FAQ.question: What's the difference between scaling and resizing? The resizer image to 5x7 dimensions tool is used to perform the scaling?"
FAQ.answer: The biggest difference between scaling and resizing lies in the way that the resolution of the image is altered. While resizing involves a more exact pixel size, scaling is a less exact process. In this case, the original image must be multiples of the final size, which can result in a pixelated effect. This is a key feature to consider when resizing an image. Using the resizer image to 5x7 dimensions tool, we can only resize images in inches; it is not useful for scaling.
